topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Modifying Images

body.p: You can modify images, as needed, to change the name and description of the image, or protect and un-protect the image.

ol.li: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.

Based on whether you are working on a project or the domain:
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Images tab.
Click the Project dashboard, then the Compute panel, then the Images tab.
The available images are listed.
In the Images screen, click More then click Edit next to the image you want to modify.

Update the image information:
Name - Enter a name for the image.
Description - Optionally, enter a brief description of the image.
Format - Select the correct format (for example, QCOW2) for the image.
Minimum Disk - Enter the minimum disk size required to boot the image. Leave the field blank to specify no minimum.
Minimum RAM (MB) - Enter the minimum memory size required to boot the image. Leave the field blank to specify no minimum.
Live Migration Timeout in seconds (120-800) - The maximum time allowed for live migration. Set to 0 to disable timeout. If unspecified, this valure defaults to 800 seconds.
Live Migration Max Downtime in milliseconds - The maximum downtime allowed for live migration in milliseconds. if unspecified, this values defaults to 500ms.
Public - Select this option to make the image public to all users with access to the current project. Leave the option clear to allow the image to be used in all projects in the domain.
Protected - Select this option to prevent the image from being deleted. Leave the option clear to allow the image to be deleted.
Instance Auto Recovery - Select this option to configure the instance for automatic recovery. Auto Recovery automatically replacing damaged or unresponsive instances.
Fields that cannot be modified are shaded.
